question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that any code you provide is executable for demonstration. This is an illustration from the Chinese literature lesson on "Lisao" (The Lament). I need you to create a webpage based on this image with the following requirements:
- Transform the image into a dynamic video, adding details from the text
- Generate a synchronized audio narration file that plays with the video, with the narration content providing supplementary knowledge about "Lisao" not covered in the lesson

checklist.title: Is the webpage structure properly implemented with HTML5 standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the HTML structure follows semantic markup principles with proper use of <header>, <main>, <section>, <footer> tags. Check for responsive design implementation with appropriate meta viewport tags and CSS media queries. Score 0 if basic HTML structure is missing, 5 if basic structure exists but lacks semantic elements, 10 if fully compliant with HTML5 standards including accessible attributes.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic video transformation successfully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code effectively transforms the static image into a dynamic video with animated elements. Check if it uses canvas manipulation, SVG animations, or HTML5 video elements with proper layering. Score 0 if no animation exists, 5 if basic animation is implemented but lacks smoothness or detail, 10 if the animation is fluid with multiple animated elements that accurately represent scenes from 'Lisao'.

checklist.title: Are the details from the text appropriately incorporated into the visual elements?
checklist.description: Examine whether specific textual details from 'Lisao' are visually represented in the animations. Check for symbolic elements (like herbs, mythical creatures, or celestial journeys mentioned in the poem), accurate historical context visualization, and visual storytelling elements. Deduct 3 points for each major textual element missing, and 5 points if the visuals contradict the poem's content. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the audio narration properly synchronized with the visual content?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of audio-visual synchronization. Check if the code includes timestamp markers for synchronization points, event listeners for coordinating audio with visual elements, and proper preloading of audio resources. Score 0 if no synchronization exists, 5 if basic synchronization is implemented but with noticeable lag, 10 if perfect synchronization with visual cues matching narration content.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, network interruption during audio/video loading, user interaction errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive elements allowing users to trigger specific poem scenes 2. Parallax scrolling effects tied to poem progression 3. Cultural context tooltips appearing alongside narration). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple animation systems overlapping) 2. Function modules unrelated to the poem presentation (e.g., unrelated social media widgets) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle effects causing lag). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core presentation is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating animation/audio/UI layers), file organization, and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points if global variable pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no performance considerations (like image optimization or lazy loading) are implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows classical Chinese aesthetic principles while maintaining modern usability: 1) Harmonious color palette reflecting the poem's tone 2) Proper layout balancing text and visuals with adequate negative space 3) Typography that honors traditional Chinese calligraphy while remaining readable. Deduct 3 points for each visually jarring element, 5 points for inappropriate modern elements that clash with the classical theme, and 5 points for poor readability. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Transitions between poem sections feel natural and contemplative 2) Animation timing reflects the emotional pacing of the poem 3) Clear visual guidance for user navigation and interaction. Deduct 5 points for jarring transitions, 3 points for animations that run too quickly to appreciate, and 5 points for confusing navigation or lack of user control options (pause/play/rewind). The full score is 10 points.
